questions.question: James worked very hard, but he could not win the prize, so please don't bring it ......................
questions.description: To bring something up is to mention it.

questions.question: His liver cancer was brought ............................... by years of drinking.
questions.description: To bring something on is to cause it to happen.

questions.question: I will call ............................ you this evening if I am free.
questions.description: To call on somebody is to visit them.

questions.question: Although she was in the last place, her parents cheered her ............................. throughout the race.
questions.description: To cheer somebody on is to encourage them.

questions.question: I wanted to tell him that I was getting married, but the chance never came .............................
I was going to take my kids to the movies, but something came .............................. and I had to cancel.
questions.description: When things come up, they happen unexpectedly.

questions.question: While I was cleaning the attic, I came .................................. this diary of my grandmother.
questions.description: To come across something is to find it by chance.

questions.question: At last her mother gave .............................. and allowed her to sleep over at her friend's house.
questions.description: To give in is to surrender in a fight or argument.

questions.question: After two weeks of trying to build my own website, I gave .................................... and hired a professional web designer.
questions.description: To give up is to stop trying.

questions.question: After leaving university, I tried to stay close to my classmates, but slowly, we grew ............................
questions.description: To grow apart is to get distant from someone.

questions.question: When we were young we used to hang ............................... in the cafe after work.
questions.description: To hang out is to spend time with someone casually.

questions.question: He hung ................................. on me even before I could finish a sentence. I will never call him again.
questions.description: To hang up on somebody is to end a call before the other person is ready.
